greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Term preceding the first zero in the Fibonacci numbers modulo n.
comment: The multiplicative order of term n modulo n is given by sequence A001176.

Let M = [{1, 1}, {1, 0}], I = [{1, 0}, {0, 1}] is the 2 X 2 identity matrix, then A001177(n) is the smallest k > 0 such that M^k == r*I (mod n) for some r such that 0 <= r < n, and a(n) gives the value r. - _Jianing Song_, Jul 04 2019
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: a(n) = F(G(n)-1) mod n where G(n) is sequence A001177 and F(m) is the m-th Fibonacci number. In particular, if n is a Fibonacci number, the n-th term is the previous Fibonacci number.
a(2^e) = 1 if e = 1, 2, 2^(e-1) + 1 if e >= 3; a(p^e) = a(p)^(p^(e-1)) mod p^e for odd primes p.
For odd primes p, a(p^e) = 1 if and only if A001177(p) == 2 (mod 4); a(p^e) = p^e - 1 if and only if 4 divides A001177(p). (End)
maple: a:= proc(n) local f, g; f, g:= 1, 0;
while f<>0 do f, g:= irem(f+g, n), f od; g
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[Mod[Fibonacci[k], n] > 0, k++]; Mod[Fibonacci[k - 1], n], {n, 2, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Sep 24 2012 *)
results.author: _David Spies_, Sep 24 2012
ext: a(14)-a(70) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 24 2012
